error.signature: ComparisonError: failed to sync application: one or more objects failed to apply

verdict.summary: ArgoCD failed to sync the desired state from Git to the Kubernetes cluster. Causes include invalid manifests, RBAC issues, resource conflicts, or CRDs not installed in the target cluster.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly clicking Sync in the ArgoCD UI without fixing the manifests
dead_ends.why_fails: If the manifests are invalid or the cluster state prevents application, retrying sync produces the same error

dead_ends.action: Using --force flag to override sync conflicts
dead_ends.why_fails: Force sync can delete and recreate resources, causing downtime and data loss. It masks the underlying issue without resolving it.

workarounds.action: Check ArgoCD app diff and fix manifest issues
workarounds.how: Run argocd app diff <app-name> to see what differs between desired and live state. Fix YAML issues in Git. Check argocd app get <app-name> for detailed sync status and error messages.

workarounds.action: Ensure CRDs and dependencies are installed before syncing
workarounds.how: Use ArgoCD sync waves and hooks: annotate CRDs with argocd.argoproj.io/sync-wave: '-1' to install them before dependent resources. Verify CRDs exist: kubectl get crd.

leads_to.condition: when ArgoCD uses Helm and the underlying Helm release fails
when migrating between GitOps tools reveals similar manifest issues

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ArgoCD sync failures occur in ArgoCD's pull-based model; FluxCD reconciliation failures occur in FluxCD's controller-based model. Different tools, similar GitOps concepts.
